# GitHub Actions workflow for Docker CI/CD
# This workflow builds, tests, scans, and pushes Docker images

name: Docker CI/CD

on:
  # Trigger on push to main or release branches
  push:
    branches:
      - main
      - develop
      - 'release/**'
    tags:
      - 'v*.*.*'

  # Trigger on pull requests to main
  pull_request:
    branches:
      - main

  # Allow manual trigger
  workflow_dispatch:

# Cancel in-progress runs for the same branch
concurrency:
  group: ${{ github.workflow }}-${{ github.ref }}
  cancel-in-progress: true

env:
  # Docker registry configuration
  REGISTRY: ghcr.io
  IMAGE_NAME: ${{ github.repository }}

  # Platforms to build for
  PLATFORMS: linux/amd64,linux/arm64

jobs:
  # ==========================================================================
  # Job 1: Build and Test
  # ==========================================================================
  build-and-test:
    name: Build and Test
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    permissions:
      contents: read
      packages: write
      security-events: write

    steps:
      # ----------------------------------------------------------------------
      # Checkout code
      # ----------------------------------------------------------------------
      - name: Checkout repository
        uses: actions/checkout@v4

      # ----------------------------------------------------------------------
      # Set up Docker Buildx (for multi-platform builds)
      # ----------------------------------------------------------------------
      - name: Set up Docker Buildx
        uses: docker/setup-buildx-action@v3
        with:
          # Use docker-container driver for better caching
          driver-opts: network=host

      # ----------------------------------------------------------------------
      # Set up QEMU (for cross-platform builds)
      # ----------------------------------------------------------------------
      - name: Set up QEMU
        uses: docker/setup-qemu-action@v3
        with:
          platforms: arm64

      # ----------------------------------------------------------------------
      # Extract metadata (tags, labels) for Docker
      # ----------------------------------------------------------------------
      - name: Extract Docker metadata
        id: meta
        uses: docker/metadata-action@v5
        with:
          images: ${{ env.REGISTRY }}/${{ env.IMAGE_NAME }}
          tags: |
            # Tag with branch name
            type=ref,event=branch
            # Tag with PR number
            type=ref,event=pr
            # Tag with semver
            type=semver,pattern={{version}}
            type=semver,pattern={{major}}.{{minor}}
            type=semver,pattern={{major}}
            # Tag with commit SHA
            type=sha,prefix={{branch}}-
            # Tag 'latest' for main branch
            type=raw,value=latest,enable={{is_default_branch}}
          labels: |
            org.opencontainers.image.title=${{ github.repository }}
            org.opencontainers.image.description=Flask application
            org.opencontainers.image.vendor=${{ github.repository_owner }}

      # ----------------------------------------------------------------------
      # Log in to container registry
      # ----------------------------------------------------------------------
      - name: Log in to GitHub Container Registry
        if: github.event_name != 'pull_request'
        uses: docker/login-action@v3
        with:
          registry: ${{ env.REGISTRY }}
          username: ${{ github.actor }}
          password: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}

      # ----------------------------------------------------------------------
      # Build Docker image (with cache)
      # ----------------------------------------------------------------------
      - name: Build Docker image
        id: build
        uses: docker/build-push-action@v5
        with:
          context: .
          platforms: ${{ env.PLATFORMS }}
          # Only push on main branch or tags
          push: ${{ github.event_name != 'pull_request' }}
          tags: ${{ steps.meta.outputs.tags }}
          labels: ${{ steps.meta.outputs.labels }}

          # Cache configuration for faster builds
          cache-from: type=gha
          cache-to: type=gha,mode=max

          # Build arguments
          build-args: |
            BUILD_DATE=${{ github.event.head_commit.timestamp }}
            VCS_REF=${{ github.sha }}
            VERSION=${{ steps.meta.outputs.version }}

          # Output to local registry for testing (PR only)
          outputs: ${{ github.event_name == 'pull_request' && 'type=docker,dest=/tmp/image.tar' || '' }}

      # ----------------------------------------------------------------------
      # Load image for testing (PR only)
      # ----------------------------------------------------------------------
      - name: Load image for testing
        if: github.event_name == 'pull_request'
        run: |
          docker load --input /tmp/image.tar
          docker image ls -a

      # ----------------------------------------------------------------------
      # Run container tests
      # ----------------------------------------------------------------------
      - name: Test Docker image
        run: |
          # Get the first tag from metadata
          IMAGE_TAG=$(echo "${{ steps.meta.outputs.tags }}" | head -n 1)

          # Run container in background
          docker run -d --name test-container \
            -p 5000:5000 \
            -e FLASK_ENV=testing \
            $IMAGE_TAG

          # Wait for container to start
          sleep 10

          # Test health endpoint
          curl -f http://localhost:5000/health || exit 1

          # Test main endpoint
          curl -f http://localhost:5000/ || exit 1

          # Check logs
          docker logs test-container

          # Stop and remove container
          docker stop test-container
          docker rm test-container

      # ----------------------------------------------------------------------
      # Security scan with Trivy
      # ----------------------------------------------------------------------
      - name: Run Trivy vulnerability scanner
        uses: aquasecurity/trivy-action@master
        with:
          image-ref: ${{ steps.meta.outputs.tags }}
          format: 'sarif'
          output: 'trivy-results.sarif'
          severity: 'CRITICAL,HIGH'
          exit-code: '1'
          ignore-unfixed: true

      # ----------------------------------------------------------------------
      # Upload Trivy results to GitHub Security
      # ----------------------------------------------------------------------
      - name: Upload Trivy results to GitHub Security
        uses: github/codeql-action/upload-sarif@v2
        if: always()
        with:
          sarif_file: 'trivy-results.sarif'

      # ----------------------------------------------------------------------
      # Generate SBOM (Software Bill of Materials)
      # ----------------------------------------------------------------------
      - name: Generate SBOM
        uses: aquasecurity/trivy-action@master
        with:
          image-ref: ${{ steps.meta.outputs.tags }}
          format: 'cyclonedx'
          output: 'sbom.json'

      # ----------------------------------------------------------------------
      # Upload SBOM as artifact
      # ----------------------------------------------------------------------
      - name: Upload SBOM
        uses: actions/upload-artifact@v3
        with:
          name: sbom
          path: sbom.json
          retention-days: 30

  # ==========================================================================
  # Job 2: Deploy to Kubernetes (only on main branch)
  # ==========================================================================
  deploy:
    name: Deploy to Kubernetes
    needs: build-and-test
    if: github.ref == 'refs/heads/main' && github.event_name == 'push'
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    environment:
      name: production
      url: https://flask-app.example.com

    steps:
      - name: Checkout repository
        uses: actions/checkout@v4

      # ----------------------------------------------------------------------
      # Set up kubectl
      # ----------------------------------------------------------------------
      - name: Set up kubectl
        uses: azure/setup-kubectl@v3
        with:
          version: 'latest'

      # ----------------------------------------------------------------------
      # Configure kubectl with cluster credentials
      # ----------------------------------------------------------------------
      - name: Configure kubectl
        run: |
          # Decode base64 kubeconfig from secrets
          echo "${{ secrets.KUBE_CONFIG }}" | base64 -d > kubeconfig.yml
          export KUBECONFIG=kubeconfig.yml

          # Verify connection
          kubectl cluster-info
          kubectl get nodes

      # ----------------------------------------------------------------------
      # Update Kubernetes deployment
      # ----------------------------------------------------------------------
      - name: Update deployment image
        run: |
          export KUBECONFIG=kubeconfig.yml

          # Set new image for deployment
          kubectl set image deployment/flask-app \
            flask-app=${{ env.REGISTRY }}/${{ env.IMAGE_NAME }}:${{ github.sha }} \
            --record

          # Wait for rollout to complete
          kubectl rollout status deployment/flask-app --timeout=5m

      # ----------------------------------------------------------------------
      # Verify deployment
      # ----------------------------------------------------------------------
      - name: Verify deployment
        run: |
          export KUBECONFIG=kubeconfig.yml

          # Check pod status
          kubectl get pods -l app=flask-app

          # Check deployment status
          kubectl get deployment flask-app

          # Test health endpoint
          kubectl run curl-test --image=curlimages/curl --rm -it --restart=Never -- \
            curl -f http://flask-app/health || exit 1

      # ----------------------------------------------------------------------
      # Cleanup
      # ----------------------------------------------------------------------
      - name: Cleanup
        if: always()
        run: |
          rm -f kubeconfig.yml

# ==============================================================================
# Secrets Required:
# ==============================================================================
#
# GITHUB_TOKEN - Automatically provided by GitHub Actions
# KUBE_CONFIG - Base64 encoded kubeconfig file for Kubernetes cluster
#   To create: cat ~/.kube/config | base64 -w 0
#
# Optional:
# DOCKER_USERNAME - Docker Hub username (if using Docker Hub)
# DOCKER_PASSWORD - Docker Hub password or access token
# SLACK_WEBHOOK - Slack webhook for notifications
#
# ==============================================================================
# Additional Features to Consider:
# ==============================================================================
#
# 1. Add Slack notifications:
#    - uses: 8398a7/action-slack@v3
#
# 2. Add container signing:
#    - uses: sigstore/cosign-installer@main
#
# 3. Add performance testing:
#    - Run load tests with k6 or Apache Bench
#
# 4. Add smoke tests:
#    - Test critical user flows after deployment
#
# 5. Add rollback on failure:
#    - kubectl rollout undo deployment/flask-app
#
# 6. Add canary deployment:
#    - Use Flagger or Argo Rollouts
#
# 7. Add cost estimation:
#    - Use Infracost for infrastructure costs
# ==============================================================================
